attributes.action: revise the Immigration and Nationality rules concerning Non-EU spouses of UK Nationals
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Why should I, as an honest, hard-working, tax-paying UK citizen be denied the fundamental right to live with my wife who is the mother of my UK-born children by this government, simply because she is a Non-EU National.
The current spouse visa process is a total disgrace and should be brought to the attention of the European Courts of Justice if this government continues this blatant infringement of our Human Rights.
We demand that this government amend its policies immediately so that:

1.	Non-EU Nationals be granted the right to settle in the UK if they are legally married to a UK National for 2 years or more.

2.	Non-EU Nationals be granted the right to settle in the UK if they have children with a UK National.

3.	Applications to vary the status of a Spouse be granted in the UK.
